page.title: 01LIVINGSTON SOUTH 03040663
page.content: {Livingston,}a 'new town', occupies about 40% of the area and is situated between{Glasgow}and{Edinburgh.}Most children are educated in{Williamston or{Bellsquarry Primary Schools.}Public playing fields and the{Crofthead {Community Centre}are the main facilities for public use.An industrial area,{Brucefield,}contains many{'high-tech'}factories.Beyond the town are farm and woodland areas.Much of this is owned by Lord Morton whose grandfather sold land which is now {Morton Reservoir.Lothian Water Board is now responsible for this.{Linhouse and{Murieston Waters}flow through the 'block' and{Murieston Trail}is a picturesque walk.{Bankton House,}a restaurant,{Murieston House}and{Skivo {House}are the oldest buildings. {Contentibus}shale bing is a remnant of the industrial past of this area.
